items.title: Get Started
items.text:
Info

Python is required to run this project.

Clone the repo :

git clone https://github.com/MathieuAudibert/Conteneurisation-Orchestration.git

Then, setup your virtual env :

Python / Windows Python / MacOS /Linux Uv 
python -m venv venv
venv\Scripts\activate

python -m venv venv
source venv/bin/activate

uv init

Once you've installed and setted your virtual env, you can install the necessary dependancies w/ pip or uv.

pip uv 
pip install -r requirements.txt

uv pip install -r requirements.txt

You're all done now !

items.title: Context
items.text:
The objective of this project is to simulate the complete lifecycle of a modern application, from its design using microservices to its deployment in production, including automation.

Students will not only have to develop a functional application but also build all the underlying infrastructure to make it run in a resilient, scalable, and automated way. This project aims to place you in the shoes of a DevOps team, where you are responsible for both the code (Dev) and the infrastructure (Ops).

The final presentation will be oriented toward showcasing these technical skills to a recruiter.

items.title: Objectives
items.text:
At the end of this project, you will be able to:

  • Understand and apply the principles of containerization and microservices.
  • Create, run, and manage containers with Docker.
  • Write optimized Dockerfiles to define reproducible environments.
  • Configure Docker Compose to orchestrate a multi-container application in a development environment.
  • Deploy, orchestrate, and scale applications on a Kubernetes cluster.
  • Define essential Kubernetes objects (Pods, Deployments, Services, Volumes, etc.).
  • Apply advanced orchestration strategies (zero-downtime updates, self-healing).
  • Integrate a CI/CD pipeline to automate containerized deployments to production.

items.title: Per category
items.text:
• Data & ETL

    • Dataset extraction
    • Retrieval and preparation of source data.
    • Creation of business rules
    • Definition of business logic and transformations to apply to the data.
    • Data transformation
    • Cleaning, normalizing, and enriching the dataset.

  • Connectors & DB

    • Setting up the MongoDB connector (API if needed)
    • Development of a connector to interact with the MongoDB database.
    • MongoDB extraction on a Docker container
    • Hosting the Mongo extraction service in a dedicated container.

  • API & Front-end

    • API development (Front & Back)
    • Implementation of communication interfaces between the front-end and back-end.
    • Front-end setup
    • Development, integration, and deployment of the user interface.

  • CI/CD

    • Automation with GitHub Actions
    • Configuration of the CI/CD pipeline to automatically push versions to Kubernetes or Docker.

  • Containerization & Infra

    • Dockerization of the ETL
    • Containerization of the ETL process using Docker.
    • Deployment of the ETL on Kubernetes
    • Orchestration and management of the ETL pipeline within a Kubernetes cluster.
    • Creation of a shared volume (DB + ETL)
    • Configuration of persistent storage for both the database and the ETL process.
    • Creation of the front-end Docker image
    • Building and deploying the front-end image in the Docker/Kubernetes environment.
